title: Daily: Paranoia -as-a-service?  Cyber con jobs.
description:
In today's Podcast,
we hear reports of success in the cyber war against ISIS. Inquiry
into the Bangladesh Bank hack continues; the threat actors behind
it may have additional capers in the works. Android malware
flourishes, and so does a vigorous underground extortion market.
The FBI says it doesn't know what vulnerability was exploited to
open the San Bernardino iPhone, and that it doesn't want a hacking
arms race with criminals and terrorists. Ferruh Matvituna from
Netsparker shares some wisdom on app security, and Jonathan Katz
from the University of Maryland explains program
obfuscation.
itunes:author: CyberWire, Inc.
itunes:subtitle: Daily: Paranoia -as-a-service?  Cyber con jobs.

content:encoded: In today's Podcast, we hear reports of success in the cyber war against ISIS. Inquiry into the Bangladesh Bank hack continues; the threat actors behind it may have additional capers in the works. Android malware flourishes, and so does a vigorous underground extortion market. The FBI says it doesn't know what vulnerability was exploited to open the San Bernardino iPhone, and that it doesn't want a hacking arms race with criminals and terrorists. Ferruh Matvituna from Netsparker shares some wisdom on app security, and Jonathan Katz from the University of Maryland explains program obfuscation.
